name: Avoid direct or indirect remote calls inside a loop
associatedValueName: Path until the remote called artifact
description:
Reports the following remote call inside a loop at a depth level less than <depth level>:
* SQL Statement through loop (example: SQL cursor on SQL Server, nested cursors on Oracle)
* Stored procedure called many times from the client in a loop.
* EJB3 Session remote method
* ABAP RFC

<depth level> is a parameter that can be changed at will.
rationale: All remote calls made inside a loop will badly impact the performances of your application.
reference: Please refer to  CISQ rule: ASCPEM-PRF-8 : http://www.omg.org/spec/ASCPEM/1.0/PDF:
remediation: This loop execution can be delegated to the server side of the application so that not network latency will occur.
total: Number of methods calling at least one method inside a loop
alternativeName: Ensure that direct or indirect remote calls inside a loop will are not used as they badly impact the performances

qualityStandards.name: Control Elements Requiring Significant Resource Element within Control Flow Loop Block
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by preventing the repeated consumption of resource due to resource consuming operations found directly or indirectly within loops.

Consequence
Software that is coded so as to execute expensive computations repeatedly (such as in loops) requires excessive computational resources when the usage and data volume grow
